exposurecontrol: Programmed auto exposure and exposure compensation (-2.0 - +2.0 EV in steps of 1/3 EV)
movierecordingactualbatterylifeforrecord: Approx. 35 min (1080/30p) when using EN-EL19. Approx. 40 min (1080/25p) when using EN-EL19
chargingtime: Approx. 1 h 50 min (when using Charging AC Adapter EH-71P and when no charge remains)
ioterminal: Micro-USB connector, HDMI micro connector (Type D) (HDMI output)
suppliedaccessories: Camera Strap, Rechargeable Li-ion Battery EN-EL19, Charging AC Adapter EH-71P, USB Cable UC-E21
continuousshooting: Single (default setting), Continuous H (the frame rate for continuous shooting is about 9.4 fps and the maximum number of continuous shots is about 7), Continuous L (the frame rate for continuous shooting is about 2 fps and themaximum number of continuous shots is about 7), Pre-shooting cache (the frame rate for continuous shooting is about 11 fps and the maximum number of continuous shots is 5, including a maximum of two frames captured in the pre-shooting cache), Continuous H:120 fps (the frame rate for continuous shooting is about 120 fps and the maximum number of continuous shots is 50), Continuous H:60 fps (the frame rate for continuous shooting is about 60 fps and the maximum number of continuous shots is 25), BSS (Best Shot Selector), Multi-shot 16
media: Internal memory (approx. 25 MB), SD/SDHC/SDXC memory card
powersources: One Rechargeable Li-ion Battery EN-EL19 (included). AC Adapter EH-62G (available separately)
selftimer: Can be selected from 10 s and 2 s
focallength: 4.5-36.0 mm (angle of view equivalent to that of 25-200 mm lens in 35mm [135] format)
dimensionswxhxd: Approx. 96.9 x 58.0 x 20.9 mm (3.9 x 2.3 x 0.9 in.) (excluding projections)
hdmioutput: Can be selected from Auto, 480p, 720p, and 1080i
exposuremeteringmode: Matrix, center-weighted (digital zoom less than 2x), spot (digital zoom 2x or more)
framecoverageplaybackmode: Approx. 99% horizontal and 99% vertical (compared to actual picture)
weight: Approx. 138 g (4.9 oz) (including battery and SD memory card)
focusrange: [W]: Approx. 50 cm (1 ft 8 in.) to infinity, [T]: Approx. 1.5m (5 ft) to infinity. Macro mode: Approx. 2 cm (0.8 in.) to infinity (wide-angle position). (All distances measured from center of front surface of lens)
flashcontrol: TTL auto flash with monitor preflashes
shutterspeed: 1/1500-1 s. 1/4000 s (maximum speed during high-speed continuous shooting). 4 s (Fireworks show scene mode)
fileformats: Still pictures: JPEG. Sound files (Voice Memo): WAV. Movies: MOV (Video: H.264/MPEG-4 AVC, Audio: LPCM stereo)
monitor: 7.5 cm (3-in.), approx. 460k-dot, TFT LCD with anti-reflection coating and 5-level brightness adjustment
focusareaselection: Face priority, manual with 99 focus areas, center, subject tracking, target finding AF
wifiwirelesslancommunicationsprotocols: IEEE 802.11b: DBPSK/DQPSK/CCK. IEEE 802.11g: OFDM. IEEE 802.11n: OFDM
supportedlanguages: Arabic, Bengali, Bulgarian, Chinese (Simplified and Traditional), Czech, Danish, Dutch, English, Finnish, French, German, Greek, Hindi, Hungarian, Indonesian, Italian, Japanese, Korean, Marathi, Norwegian, Persian, Polish, Portuguese (European and Brazilian), Romanian, Russian, Serbian, Spanish, Swedish, Tamil, Telugu, Thai, Turkish, Ukrainian, Vietnamese
wifiwirelesslandataratesactualmeasuredva: IEEE 802.11b: 5 Mbps. IEEE 802.11g: 20 Mbps. IEEE 802.11n: 20 Mbps
shootingmodes: Scene auto selector, Scene (Portrait, Landscape, Sports, Night portrait, Party/indoor, Beach, Snow, Sunset, Dusk/dawn, Night landscape, Close-up, Food, Museum, Fireworks show, Black and white copy, Backlighting, Easy panorama, Pet portrait), Special effects, Smart portrait, Auto
imagesensor: 1/2.3-in. type CMOS; approx. 16.76 million total pixels
digitalzoommagnification: Up to 4x (angle of view equivalent to that of approx. 800 mm lens in 35mm [135] format)
framecoverageshootingmode: Approx. 97% horizontal and 97% vertical (compared to actual picture)
isosensitivitystandardoutputsensitivity: ISO 125-1600. ISO 3200, 6400 (available when using Auto mode)
vibrationreduction: Lens shift (still pictures). Lens shift and electronic VR (movies)
